thread.title: Last person to 'see Tara Palmer-Tomkinson before tragic death' said socialite was in "good spirits" despite being in pain
thread.title_full: Last person to 'see Tara Palmer-Tomkinson before tragic death' said socialite was in "good spirits" despite being in pain

author: Vicki Newman
title: Last person to 'see Tara Palmer-Tomkinson before tragic death' said socialite was in "good spirits" despite being in pain
text:
The man believed to be the last person to see Tara Palmer-Tomkinson alive said she was in "good spirits" (Photo: 2016 David M. Benett) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The man believed to be the last person to see Tara Palmer-Tomkinson alive said she was in "good spirits" before her tragic death. 
American film producer Joe Simon says he spent the last Friday night before the socialite's death at her £4.4 million London flat, where they enjoyed a Chinese takeaway. 
The 50-year-old has said that despite her complaining of pain from a rare autoimmune disease, she was in "good spirits" and even text him the following morning to thank him for a fun evening. Read More Tara Palmer-Tomkinson was found dead on Wednesday (Photo: Getty) Tara with JOe in 1999 (Photo: Rex Features) 
Art connoisseur Joe had been friends with Tara for more than 20 years. 
"She was in good spirits that night, despite being in tremendous pain," Joe told a friend, according to the Mail on Sunday. 
"I believe I was the last person to see her alive and we have a lovely evening. We spent last Friday night together at her flat and ordered Chinese takeaway – Peking duck, which was her favourite. 
"It was something we’d done on Friday nights for months because she was no longer going out. She played the piano and was in good spirits. She had some alcohol but there was no sign she was on drugs." Read More Joe said his friend was in pain Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
